pullrequest.title: Clamp window size to fit screen

content.raw:
I tested this on a laptop with an external monitor. I noticed the following:

1. One  time when launching the huge\_window config, it resized it to the builtin laptop display’s size, but it ended up showing it on the external monitor \(where resizing wasn’t necessary\). Is there a way to know the size of the display that will be used?
2. Resizing to exactly the detected resolution doesn’t quite resolve the original issue, because if I have a menubar at the top of my screen, I still can’t access the bottom of the window  to resize the window. Perhaps it is possible to detect the maximum  possible window size in a way that accounts for these menus \(or just add  a buffer, but that’s a bit arbitrary\).
3. It’d be nice but not necessary to also reposition the position of the window if it’s been shrunk. Currently it can be made to fit by dragging it up, but it still starts off the monitor.

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/512309280-scene3d_resized.png)
‌
